meanings.definition: Notes or comments on a text, especially in the margins.
meanings.sent1: The scholia in the book helped me understand the story better.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed reading the scholia written by the previous owner of the book.
meanings.sent3: The scholia in the textbook made a boring subject seem interesting.
meanings.sent4: Her scholia on the novel were like little gems of insight.
meanings.sent5: The colorful scholia in the margins made the old book come alive.

meanings.definition: A collection of such notes or comments.
meanings.sent1: The library had a vast collection of scholia from different scholars.
meanings.sent2: He spent hours going through the scholia gathered over the years.
meanings.sent3: The collection of scholia was so extensive it filled multiple shelves.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a rich tapestry woven with the diverse scholia she had read.
meanings.sent5: The treasure trove of scholia was a delight for any book lover.

meanings.definition: The act of making such notes or comments.
meanings.sent1: Her scholia on the poem reflected her deep understanding of the text.
meanings.sent2: The professor's scholia during the lecture were insightful and helpful.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't resist adding his own scholia to the ancient manuscript.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet library, the sound of pen scratching paper signaled the scholia in progress.
meanings.sent5: The art of scholia requires attention to detail and critical thinking.
